The Mind-Body Connection [Anxiety](https://www.cdc.gov/tobacco/campaign/tips/diseases/depression-anxiety.html) is not just a mental state; it manifests physically as well. Racing heartbeat, shallow breathing, and tense muscles are all common symptoms. To address anxiety holistically, it's essential to understand the mind-body connection. This is where mindfulness meditation comes into play. Mindfulness meditation is a practice that involves paying attention to the present moment with non-judgmental awareness. By focusing on your breath, bodily sensations, and thoughts without getting caught up in them, you can cultivate a sense of calm and improve your overall well-being.
